  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29166].
  {panel}

Deleting a previous revision of a blog post requires permission as a 'Space Administrator', even with the permission, deletion is not permitted.

+Reproduction:+
* Create a new blog post
* Make a revision of the post

+Expected Behaviour:+
* Access 'Tools' > 'Space History'
* Check previous revision
* Select 'Delete'
* Previous revision is added to trash and can either be purged or restored by space administrator

+Current Behaviour:+
* Access 'Tools' > 'Space History'
* Check previous revision
* Select 'Delete'
* Receive message "Not Permitted, You are not permitted to perform this operation"

Users are unable to delete blog histories and hit into *Not Permitted, You are not permitted to perform this operation.*

+Workaround:+ 
(Available for Confluence Server)
* Delete the page previous versions, and set the current version as "V.1" from the database
* Guide is available from the documentation: [How to Remove all Previous Versions of a Page Manually in the Database Using SQL Commands|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Remove+all+Previous+Versions+of+a+Page+Manually+in+the+Database+Using+SQL+Commands]
fields.summary: Unable to delete blog version

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29162].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Open the template editor
# Insert a code macro
# Insert a template variable into the code macro
# Save the template
# Create a page from the template

The user will not be prompted to insert a value for the variable.
In addition, if they attempt to edit the template, the variable will also have disappeared.

We should either allow the template variables to function inside code macros as they if they weren't inside the code macro. Or we should at least not allow template variables to be inserted into code macros.

Pre 4.3 (before we revamped page templates / template variables) template variables could be used in code macros but ONLY if the template variables was repeated somewhere else on the page outside a code macro. So even before this template variables in code macros did not work that great.
fields.summary: template variables cannot be used in code macros

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29144].
  {panel}

If a user receives a direct link to a file on Confluence, they used to be asked to log in, and were then redirected to the file.

However, since 5.1-OD-5, the redirect instead sends the user to a 'This action is not permitted' page after being logged in.

The login screen will direct to {{login.action?os_destination=%2Fnotpermitted.action%3Fversion%3D1%26modificationDate%3D1366730801169%26api%3Dv2}}, instead of {{login?dest-url=%2Fwiki%2Fdownload%2Fattachments%2F622598%2Ffilename%3Fapi%3Dv2}}

This prevents users from opening files easily from their email notifications.

*Steps to reproduce*
In a default Confluence instance.
* Create a new Space and File list
* Upload a file
* Once uploaded, copy the link URL to the file.
* Log out
* Paste the link in your browser
** _You will be asked to log in_
* Log in, and you will see 'Action not permitted'



Note:
Able to replicate with *'user logged in initially'* in Confluence version 5.3.4.
fields.summary: Directly being linked to an attachment before logging in will redirect to a 'action not permitted' message

h3. Problem Definition
Edit in Office permissions are currently set via giving a user Page Add permission. While this made sense when Confluence used the View File macro to embed Office content into a Confluence page - and thus editing the Office document was essentially the same as editing the page - it does not hold true anymore. The new File Preview experience clearly emphasizes the fact that Office documents are attachments, and it can be confusing to set Page Add permissions for operations involving attachments.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the permissions scheme used for Edit in Office to check against Attachment Add instead of Page Add.

  {panel}

Currently, the macro allows custom titles, which is good!

But, the title style is locked at H2, which is limiting.

See this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/STASH/Stash+upgrade+guide

In this case, to have the TOC macro display the "Upgrading to Stash x.x" items, without the "Known issues" headings, the former headings have to be made H3, and the TOC macro set to ignore H2.

This achieves a useful TOC, but mucks with the heading levels of the page... what is needed here is to be able to set the JIRA issues macro title to H3 or H4.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
It appears the H2 heading is only locked when the JIRA issues macro is being to Static style.
When set to Dynamic, the title will take over the heading as used within the macro itself.
Additionally, when set to static, the title appears to fall outside of the macro window, where as it stays inside when set to dynamic.
The issues-subheading class is set to H2, so custom css will not provide a solution here.
This has been tested with version 4.0.29 of the JIRA Issues Macro.
The version 4.0.17 does not appear to show this behavior
fields.summary: Please provide a way to set the title font size/style for the JIRA issues macro

The new editor does not properly create links that do not use one of the standard web protocols when inserting with the Insert Link dialog (e.g. http://, ftp://).  It creates the <a> but without a href attribute.  In 3.5 and earlier, you could create a link for any protocol type using wiki markup: \[something://mysite.com\].  Inserting the wiki markup results in the link being stripped and the URI appearing as plaintext.

The only workaround is to insert a link manually with the HTML macro, but not all sites will be able to enable this macro for security reasons.


---
The fix in 4.3.7 allows non-standard protocols, but not if they have numbers in the protocol.

e.g. exp://Ticket/12345 works fine but exp2://Ticket/12345 is not rendered as a link.
fields.summary: Non-standard protocol links with numbers aren't rendered as links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-29072].
  {panel}

Users are being duplicated in the People directory each time Confluence is restarted, until a re-index is performed (at which time the duplicates are removed).

If you encounter a bug where your people directory is displaying duplicates and this _isn't_ fixed by performing a re-index, it's likely that you're affected by CONF-30050.

Please take a look at this Knowledge Base article for more information:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Duplicates+in+the+People+Directory

h2. Workaround
*Step 1.* [Rebuild the search index|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+Index+Administration#ContentIndexAdministration-RebuildingtheContentIndexes] to remove the duplicates in the people directory.
*Step 2.* Perform an action that will add a different type of indexing task to the queue before your instance is restarted - e.g. create a page in Confluence.

If this doesn't work for you, please [raise a support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa] so that we can investigate further.
fields.summary: Users are duplicated in People Directory each time Confluence restarts

We use the red/yellow/green stars for a dashboard.  The resulting code  generated includes alternative text in 4.3.7, which is a positive change from the past version we used.  However, the alt for these stars is:

alt="(red star)"
alt="(star)"
alt="(green star)"

Alternative text should never have the parentheses unless needed to represent parenthetical information, which wouldn't include stars.

In addition, since you are providing multi-color stars, the color is important.  Perhaps not in all cases, but since it is in some it is necessary to include the color for all of the stars.  Therefore, the alts should be:

alt="red star"
alt="yellow star"
alt="green star"

This change will help the blind members of my team use Confluence.
fields.summary: Incorrect alternative text for emoticons

  {panel}

h5. Steps to reproduce:
# Insert a relative link to a Confluence page via Insert > Web Link > Address: /conf43/display/ds/test
# Save the page and you can see that the domain address is appended to the relative path e.g. http://www.atlassian.com/conf43/display/ds/test

Confluence no longer supports writing a web link as a relative URL, however you can get around this still by inserting a non-web link. If you look at the instructions on [Linking to Pages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/uADGDg], the following ways will work effectively as relative links:

# Adding a link using autocomplete
# Adding a link using the Insert Link dialog (either search or recently viewed)

This kind of link does not store the base URL of your Confluence instance, it refers to the page by the (space id, page id) pair. This also means that if the page name changes, then the link will still work. If you left the link text the same as the page name originally, then it should automatically update to the new page name as well.

While the methods described above works for a single page, you cannot use autocomplete or the search to find the rss action page. For instance, you'd like to make a relative link to an rss feed such as this:
{code}
/createrssfeed.action?types=page&spaces=conf_all&title=pagename&labelString=work&excludedSpaceKeys %3D&sort=modified&maxResults=30&timeSpan=30&showContent=true&confirm=Create+RSS+Feed&os_authType=basic{code}

The methods described won't work because the link is not a Confluence page. Using the insert link dialog, you can insert this relative link as a web link but it will be saved as a absolute link instead. This is also becoming a problem when you are trying to move a staging server to a production server. You'll have to manually change the link individually to match the current production domain.
fields.summary: Prevent relative web links from being converted to absolute links

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h4. Background of Request

As of now, Confluence send out an e-mail of recommended updates according to the popularity of the content(s). This feature will search the whole Confluence instance and pick the most popular content based on votes and comments. Since this feature include the whole Confluence instance, there is a big possibility that Confluence missed important updates from spaces they have included as their favorite space(s). 

By having recommended updates for each user favorite space(s), Confluence user will get a more specific updates from their preferred content genre such as IT Department Space or Accounting Department Space.

h4. Proposed Implementation

I proposed, recommended updates per favorite space which can be configured, for example:

* Space A -- Recommended Updates -- Send out in Monday
* Space B -- Recommended Updates -- Send out in Wednesday

For example, a Confluence content regarding an event discussion such as dinner get more votes and comment compared with a procedure updates from talent department.

Global Look and Feel Cannot be Applied to Individual Spaces when Documentation Theme is Set on Global.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# As default you're using the default documentation in the *Global Look and feel*
# Go to _Browse > Confluence Admin > Themes_ and change to *Documentation theme*
# Now go to a space, that you're sure that has the *Global Look and feel* theme.
# You'll see that the theme was changed.
# Go to the Space Admin, and try to change to *Documentation theme*' you'll see that the theme will not change.

*Workaround*
Changing the Global Theme on your instance to "Default Theme" should do the trick of restoring the ability of configuring the sidebar of any space using Global Look and Feel.
